element.name: bkg.wl.edm.location
element.documentation: Set to the patient's EDM Location at the time this entry was filed. If this value is changed on the patient's file BEFORE the background job processes this transaction, then the background job will NOT file this transaction.

element.name: bkg.wl.status.event
element.documentation: Set to the patient's status event at the time this entry was filed. If this value is changed on the patient's file BEFORE the background job processes this transaction, then the background job will NOT file this transaction.

element.name: bkg.wl.action
element.documentation: A = Add to wait list R = Remove from wait list

element.name: bkg.wl.wait.list
element.documentation: Wait list to add/remove patient to/from.

element.name: bkg.wl.wait.list.number
element.documentation:
This will *ONLY* exist if the patient file has been deleted, and thus this info is no longer available. For example, when we "match" a temp account to a real account, the two patient files are merged, and the temp file is deleted. If the merge program (%EDM.PAT.merge.edm.data) is unable to delete the temp patient from the Wait List (because it is locked by another job), a bkg transaction will be set up with this piece set.
Thus, this will only exist for a "D" (Delete) type transaction for which the patient file no longer exists.

element.name: user
element.documentation: The signed on user

element.name: cover.for
element.documentation: User being covered for

element.name: covering
element.documentation: "Y" if the cover.for user is currently being covered, "N" or "" otherwise.

element.name: last.covered.date
element.documentation: The last date that this covered.for user was actually...covered for.

element.name: current.location
element.attributes: CTF=pt edm location=Patient's EDM location ID.SEL=@EDM.LOC.facilities[CD,@.facility] PRE09=@.new@Tr.l2u^@.new^@.new.ext

element.name: complaint
element.attributes: CTF=pt chief complaint=Patient's Chief complaint mnemonic ID=%EDM.COMPLAINT.id(A,"A","AR") PRE1=@.new@Tr.l2u^@.new^@.new.ext^G

element.name: status.event
element.attributes: CTF=pt status event=Patient's status event PRE09=@.new@Tr.l2u^@.new^@.new.ext
element.documentation:
This can be set in one of two ways:
1) The user can manually change this value via the 'Update Status Event' rtn. 2) In the Status Event Dictionary, if a status event is associated with a function, and the user performs that function, then the patient's status event is automatically updated to that status event.

element.name: wait.list.number
element.attributes: CTF=pt wait number=Patient's wait list number
element.documentation: This is used to place all "waiting" patients into an ordered list. Ideally, patients should be "seen" by a doctor in the order of this list. This number is assigned by the user during Reception. Or, this value is calcualted automatically if the background job is filing a new patient.

element.name: repeat.visit
element.documentation: This program is setup by EDM.PAT.repeat.visit.check. When a patient registration is detected by the bkg job, the bkg job will call that program. That program will then try to mark that patient as "Y" if the patient has prior ER visits in a specified timeframe. "Y" prior visits found

element.name: wait.list.mnemonic
element.attributes: CTF=pt wait list mnem=Patient's wait list mnemonic

element.name: room
element.attributes: CTF=pt room=Patient's Room & Treatment Area ID=%EDM.RTA.id(A) PRE09=@.new@Tr.l2u^@.new^@.new.ext

element.name: pd.status
element.documentation:
The lowest status of all Physician Documentation Reports.
These statuses are defined in MIS.PD.STATUS.statuses.

element.name: severity
element.documentation: Patient's are given a severity of 9 upon completion of the reception routine. This can be changed to any value between 1-9 by clicking on the keywords "pt severity", "pt priority", and "pt priority name".

element.name: adm.status
element.documentation: This is the patient's ADM status (e.g, REG ER). We need a way to detect when the patient's status is changed (e.g., from PRE ER to REG ER). When CEN transactions are picked up from the ADM xfer queue, we compare this value with the value which is placed on the xfer queue, and if different, appropriate action is taken.

element.name: adm.observation.patient
element.documentation:
Equals "Y" if the patient is an observation patient, else equals nil.
See tech doc for data def @EDM.PAT.adm.status for explanation.

element.name: acuity
element.documentation: Patient's total calculated acuity.

element.name: acuity.bill.date
element.documentation: This is the bill date (@bill.txn.date) for the the acuity based care level charge.

element.name: acuity.bill.q
element.documentation: This is the billing sequence number (@bill.txn.q) for the the acuity based care level charge.

element.name: log.date
element.documentation:
This is the date for which the patient appears on the daily log.
- It will usually be the arrival date if the patient was entered as a PRE ER patient first (either through Reception or ADM's PRE ER routine)
- It will usually be the service date if the patient was immediately registered.
- The daily log is not updated however, so if a patient's arrival or service date was edited, the log date would not necessarily be equal to either of them. (it would still reflect the original value) * This is an important consideration - if the log date was edited, it could be backdated so that the acuity calculation would be missed by the midnight run.

element.name: xfer.from.ed
element.documentation:
For accounts that have gone from ER to ADM IN or REG SDC, this element represents which date/time is being used as the date/time the account left the ER.
Set to "ADM" for ER to ADM IN accts and use ADM.PAT.admit.date + admit.time. Set to "SVC" for ER to REG SDC accts and use ADM.PAT.service.date + service.time Will have no value ("") for ER accts.

element.name: xfer.patient
element.documentation: Set to "Y" if this patient is a transfer from ADM, i.e. a /A lookup was performed in the reception routine.

element.name: repeat.visit.num
element.attributes: CTF=pt repeat visit num=Repeat Visit Num

element.name: record.locked
element.documentation: Whether or not a record is currently locked to edits. "" = "N"

element.name: record.locked.date
element.documentation: The date the record was locked last. This date will be set when the record is locked by the file maintenance job, and deleted if the record is ever unlocked manually. This date is used as the 'date' subscript on @locked.date.x

element.name: default.patient
element.documentation: Used for DFTC attributes on patient ID screens. Also, when this is set, program %ADM.PAT.id will not ask for confirmation when ID'ing patient's by acct number.

element.name: delete.date
element.documentation: This is used to define the @EDM.PAT.delete.acct.x segment. This is the firstsubscript of that index. It is the date on which the patient was filed to the delete.acct.x index.

element.name: registration.date
element.documentation: This is used to define the @EDM.PAT.daily.log.x data segment. This is the first subscript of that index. This is the date that a patient first arrived into the ED. This is arrived at by taking the lesser of the Service Date and the Triage Date.

element.name: registration.time
element.documentation: This is used to define the @EDM.PAT.daily.log.x data segment. This is a subscript of that index. This is the time that a patient first arrived into the ED. This is arrived at by taking the lesser of the Service Time and the Triage Time.

element.name: pt.priority.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt priority name=Patient's priority name VAL=@EDM.PRI.name[@EDM.PAT.priority]
element.documentation: This has been added so that the field will be available as a Data Field.The CTF and VAL are provided so that the MIS.DATA.DICT.init.edm will build thisfield into the Data field dictionary with the proper Magic code defined.It is similar to how the Magic Code is defined in EDM's Keyword dictionaryexcept that the definitions are in MIS. This way the field is available in such places as OA messages

element.name: pt.chf.complaint.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt chf complnt name=Patient's Chief Complaint name VAL=@EDM.COMPLAINT.name[@EDM.PAT.complaint]
element.documentation: This has been added so that the field will be available as a Data Field.The CTF and VAL are provided so that the MIS.DATA.DICT.init.edm will build thisfield into the Data field dictionary with the proper Magic code defined.It is similar to how the Magic Code is defined in EDM's Keyword dictionaryexcept that the definitions are in MIS. This way the field is available in such places as OA messages

element.name: pt.nurse.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt ER nurse name=Patient's ER nurse's name VAL=@UNV.USER.name[@EDM.PAT.nurse]
element.documentation: This has been added so that the field will be available as a Data Field.The CTF and VAL are provided so that the MIS.DATA.DICT.init.edm will build thisfield into the Data field dictionary with the proper Magic code defined.It is similar to how the Magic Code is defined in EDM's Keyword dictionaryexcept that the definitions are in MIS. This way the field is available in such places as OA messages

element.name: pt.practitioner.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt practitioner name=Patient's ER practitioner's name VAL=@UNV.USER.name[@EDM.PAT.practitioner]
element.documentation: This has been added so that the field will be available as a Data Field.The CTF and VAL are provided so that the MIS.DATA.DICT.init.edm will build thisfield into the Data field dictionary with the proper Magic code defined.It is similar to how the Magic Code is defined in EDM's Keyword dictionaryexcept that the definitions are in MIS. This way the field is available in such places as OA messages

element.name: pt.room.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt room name=Patient's Room & Treatment Area Descr VAL=@EDM.RTA.name[@EDM.PAT.room]
element.documentation: This has been added so that the field will be available as a Data Field.The CTF and VAL are provided so that the MIS.DATA.DICT.init.edm will build thisfield into the Data field dictionary with the proper Magic code defined.It is similar to how the Magic Code is defined in EDM's Keyword dictionaryexcept that the definitions are in MIS. This way the field is available in such places as OA messages

element.name: pt.status.event.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt status event name=Patient's status event name VAL=@EDM.EVENTS.name[@EDM.PAT.status.event]
element.documentation: This has been added so that the field will be available as a Data Field.The CTF and VAL are provided so that the MIS.DATA.DICT.init.edm will build thisfield into the Data field dictionary with the proper Magic code defined.It is similar to how the Magic Code is defined in EDM's Keyword dictionaryexcept that the definitions are in MIS. This way the field is available in such places as OA messages

element.name: pt.arrival.mode
element.attributes: CTF=pt arrival mode mne=Patient's arrival mode VAL=@ADM.PAT.arrived.from

element.name: pt.arrival.mode.name
element.attributes: CTF=pt arrival mode=Patient's arrival mode name VAL=@MIS.ARRIV.name[@ADM.PAT.arrived.from]

element.name: pt.stated.complaint
element.attributes: CTF=pt stated cmplnt=Patient's stated complaint VAL=@ADM.PAT.reason.for.visit

element.name: pt.wait.time.total
element.attributes: CTF=pt wait time total=Patient's total waiting time VAL=%EDM.PAT.keyword.wait.time(/urn,1)

element.name: adm.service.req
element.attributes: CTF=pt adm svc rq=Patient's ADM service requested PRE09=IF{"Y"=@EDM.PARAM.use.upper.case @.new@Tr.l2u^@.new^@.new.ext}
element.documentation: This is the service requested when using the Admission Request routine.

element.name: adm.req.cds
element.documentation:
This is a CDS (if any) which was filled out when using the Admission Request routine. The results are stored in:
EDM.PAT.edm.data.adm.rqst.cds.rs (scalars) EDM.PAT.edm.data.adm.rqst.cds.rsm (multiples)

element.name: bill.txn.type
element.documentation: D=Debit C=Credit

element.name: bill.txn.user
element.documentation: The user who generated the transaction.

element.name: bill.txn.credit.date
element.documentation: When a previously debited transaction is credited, this flag is set on the original "debit" transaction. This flag is set to the date that the credit was performed.

element.name: bill.txn.credit.user
element.documentation: If a debit is credited, this is the user who filed the credit. This is set on the original debit transaction.

element.name: bill.txn.service.date
element.documentation: Indicates the service date of the activity which caused the transaction, which may me different then the billing date. Service date - when the activity being billed for was done. Billing date - when the activity being billed for was entered into the system.

element.name: bill.txn.source
element.documentation: Intervention Care Level

element.name: bill.txn.subsource
element.documentation:
Indicates more specifically the basis for an intervention-based charge. F - Flat Rate E - Elapsed Time Q - Quantity R - Query Response
Possible values for Care-Level Charges. S - System generated (acuity based) "" - User entered

element.name: bill.txn.prof
element.documentation: Indicates whether this billing txn is for a professional fee. (Intervention type txns only)

element.name: bill.txn.prof.cp
element.documentation: If the txn is for a professional fee, the careprovider who would get the fee is listed here. This is collected by a query on a CDS. (Intervention type txns only)

element.name: bill.txn.ignore
element.documentation: Sometimes a txn will be undone or credited just after it is entered. If the original debit txn has already gone to B/AR then the offsetting credit must also be sent. If the original debit txn has not already gone to B/AR, however, then this flag can be sent so that it will never go. An offsetting credit txn should also be created with the same flag set. This way EDM has a complete audit of all debits and credits but the midnight run and B/AR module does not have to work through unneccesary offetting txns.

element.name: call.caller
element.documentation: The name of the person that called in to the ED.

element.name: call.contact
element.documentation: The user who received/processed the call.

element.name: call.user
element.documentation: User who FILED the call.

element.name: call.sum.width
element.documentation: Width of the text editor region when entering a call summary in the Call Management routine.

element.name: dep.filed.dis.instr
element.documentation:
This is set to indicate that the user has filed the list of discharge instructions at least once. This way the system will know to look at the patient file for filed instructions as opposed to looking at the complaint dictionary for suggested instructions when determining whether or not a checkmark should appear.
This is necessary because the user may have unselected certain instructions which would delete them from the patient file. (In other words there is no other way to differentiate between when a user has not yet chosen which instructions should print, and when a user has deliberately specified that no instructions should print)

element.name: dep.filed.misc.forms
element.documentation:
This is set to indicate that the user has filed the list of miscellaneous departure forms at least once. This way the system will know to look at the patient file for filed departure forms as opposed to looking at the complaint dictionary for suggested departure forms when determining whether or not a checkmark should appear.
This is necessary because the user may have unselected certain forms which would delete them from the patient file. (In other words there is no other way to differentiate between when a user has not yet chosen which forms should print, and when a user has deliberately specified that no forms should print)

element.name: dep.packet.date
element.documentation: This is the DATE the Departure Packet was FIRST printed. This field is only used in non-PIC EDM db's.

element.name: dep.packet.time
element.documentation: This is the TIME the Departure Packet was FIRST printed. This field is only used in non-PIC EDM db's.

element.name: dep.update.date
element.documentation: This is the date the departure info was last filed. It is strictly a display field in the UI Depart table.

element.name: dep.update.time
element.documentation: This is the time the departure info was last filed. It is strictly a display field in the UI Depart table.

element.name: dep.filed.family.referral
element.documentation: Set to "Y" if the patient's family doctor has defaulted in either from the depart routine or PCM.

element.name: dep.primary.impression
element.documentation: Primary impression urn.

element.name: dep.display.unchecked
element.documentation:
Flag set to save Display Checked button status.
N = don't display checked Y = display checked

element.name: doc.type
element.documentation:
R = Report A = Addendum
Once a report has been signed, users may only enter addenda. Once a particular addendum is signed, a new addendum must be created for further reporting.

element.name: doc.status
element.documentation: INC = Incomplete DRF = Draft SGN = Signed CAN = Cancelled (Only Signed documents can be cancelled) DEL = Deleted (Only Incomplete & Draft docs can be deleted)

element.name: doc.edit.action
element.documentation: NEW = New EDIT = Edit MIS EDIT = Edited from MIS Sign routine DEL = Delete CAN = Cancel UNC = Uncancel

element.name: sign.urn.provider
element.documentation: This is a provider who was been queued up as needing to sign this document.

element.name: doc.sign.by
element.documentation: This is the signature which will be attached to the document. This may not necessarily be the ER Physician. If another provider is set up as an alternate provider, and they sign for the ER Physician, then that provider's signature will be attached to the document (i.e., not the ER Physician).

element.name: doc.sign.for
element.documentation: This will be different than the @doc.sign.by value only if a doctor signs for another doctor (they must be set up as an alternate in order to do so).

element.name: doc.sign.user
element.documentation:
This is the user who was signed on when a signature was attached. Users can be given priveleges to attach a provider's signature to a document. If a non-provider (e.g., unit clerk) attaches a provider's signature to a document (e.g., via MIS Sign Documents routine), then that document is not considerred as "electronically signed." Only when a provider attaches his signature can a document be considerred electronically signed. We are currently not subject to any HIPPA regulations regarding electronic signature, as those regulations apply to EDI Transactions only (Electronic Data Interchange). However, MEDITECH guarantees non-repudiation for electronic signature. If a "user" attaches a provider's signature, I don't believe that guarantees non-repudiation. Thus,if this user is not equal to the @doc.sign.by value, then the @doc.sign.by signature can *NOT* be considerred "electronic."
Typically, unit clerks will mark documents as signed in the MIS Sign Documents routine after a physician has physically signed a hard-copy of the document.

element.name: doc.sig.hx.action
element.documentation: ADD = Add DEL = Delete

element.name: doc.sig.hx.signature
element.documentation: This is the signature upon which the action (add, delete) was performed.

element.name: doc.text
element.documentation: The length of this data def should be the same as the value of @EDM.U.patient.report.width.

element.name: edit.hist.action
element.documentation: EC = Edit Chief Complaint EP = Edit Priority ES = Edit Severity EI = Edit Impression

element.name: ta.repeat.ctr
element.documentation:
This subscripts helps to distinguish multiple occurrences in a repeatable label. The value of this subscript is as follows:
MIS.ASSMNT.label.q_._occurrence#
For non-repeatable labels, the 'occurrence#' is always zero.

element.name: ta.treatment.ordered
element.documentation: This flag is set to "Y" if the bkg job detects an order that was placed for this treatment.

element.name: ta.complaint.req
element.documentation: Indicates this treatment/assessment is required by the chief complaint.

element.name: ta.orders
element.documentation: Added with dts 305. This element tracks the number of times a given treatment has been ordered (by virtue of having an attached OE order in the Assessment dictionary.) This counter will only ever be incremented; it never decrements, even if the treatment order is cancelled.

element.name: ta.cancelled
element.documentation: Added on dts 305 This counter tracks the number of times a treatment with an associated order (in the Assessment dictionary) has been cancelled. This counter only increases, it will never decrease.

element.name: pcs.file
element.documentation: This temp structure is used by program %EDM.PAT.triage.build.pcs.file to build the "PCS" entry for the HUB-PCS queue.

element.name: ta.sub.assmnt
element.documentation:
This is the actual assessment for the collection of queries below this segment.
For non-group assessments, this is the same as @ta.assmnt. For group assessments, this would be a sub-assessment under @ta.assmnt.

element.name: ta.ctr
element.documentation:
This subscript is used to differentiate between multiple documentations on the same date and time, but it also carries with it larger implications for edits and undos.
Original documentations will always have a positive integer value. This number is sequential.
So the first documentation on 12/31/00 at 1200 will be subscripted as follows: [20001231,1200,1]
The next documentation for that time (practically speaking this would be rare) would be [20001231,1200,2]
Because we keep both the old and new information for edits we simply setup a different counter for the new values. This is where we start to use decimals. The first edit of the [20001231,1200,2] documentation would be stored in [20001231,1200,2.01] Edits are also sequential, The left side of the decimal is always the same as the documentation that was edited, and the right side increments by .01.. So now, if we want to edit the [20001231,1200,2.01] we would put it in [20001231,1200,2.02]
Lastly, to Undo a documentation we would setup yet another node.. Again, we would use a decimal, but we would skip to the end and use .99 So, sticking with the above example, if we then wanted to Undo [20001231,1200,2.02] we would get [20001231,1200,2.99]

element.name: ta.doc.guid
element.documentation: GUID is a mnemonic for "Guaranteed Unique Identifier". EMR and PCS use GUIDs to keep track of documentations. Every transaction will consist of 2 GUIDs: a documentation guid and an occurrence guid. The doc guid is generated once when a new documentation is filed, and is copied forward to each edit and undo. An occ guid is generated every time any action is performed (e.g., document, edit, or undo). Occ guids are never copied forward - a new one is generated every time.

element.name: ta.occ.guid
element.documentation: GUID is a mnemonic for "Guaranteed Unique Identifier". EMR and PCS use GUIDs to keep track of documentations. Every transaction will consist of 2 GUIDs: a documentation guid and an occurrence guid. The doc guid is generated once when a new documentation is filed, and is copied forward to each edit and undo. An occ guid is generated every time any action is performed (e.g., document, edit, or undo). Occ guids are never copied forward - a new one is generated every time.

element.name: ta.ccdqr.audit.urn
element.documentation: Added by CS EDM Request #662. This urn is provided by MRI in order to separate repeatable documentations with the same date, time and ctr in the MRI CCDQR. Documentations made prior to this DTS will not have this urn stored. Additionally this will not be stored on assessments attached to NUR interventions. In those cases the urn will be stored and managed in NUR.

element.name: note.user
element.documentation: This is the user who interacted with the patient, and thus who is responsible for this particular note.

element.name: note.time
element.documentation: S(0). Represents the time that the user interacted with the patient. This defaults to the "file" time, however users may change it if they are entering a note hours later (e.g., if they fall behind in their paperwork).

element.name: note.inactive
element.documentation: "Y" if note has been inactivated.

element.name: note.undo.user
element.documentation: This is the user who inactivated the note via the "Undo" function in the Patient Notes routine.

element.name: note.file.user
element.documentation: This is the user who actually filed the note. In most cases, this will be the same as the @note.user, however in cases where one user enters a note for another user, this will be different (e.g., @note.user would be the user who interacted with the patient, and @note.file.user would be the user who signed onto the EDM module and entered the note).

element.name: note.file.time
element.documentation: S(0). This is the actual time that the note was filed. This is used for internal and auditing purposes only (i.e., it does not represent the time that the user interacted with the patient).

element.name: note.nur.ctr
element.documentation: Points to the NUR note urn, for those notes that were copied to NUR.

element.name: amend.inactive
element.documentation: Set to "Y" if this ammendment is inactive.

element.name: amend.undo.user
element.documentation: This is the user who inactivated the ammendment via the "Undo" function in the Patient Notes routine.

element.name: amend.text
element.documentation: The length of this data def should be the same as the value of @EDM.U.patient.note.width.

element.name: note.text
element.documentation: The length of this data def should be the same as the value of @EDM.U.patient.report.width.

element.name: order.status
element.documentation:
Equivalent to the expanded value of @OE.ORD.status.
TRN = Order on interface queue LOG = Picked up by interfacing module

element.name: results.resulted.time
element.documentation: Used for indexing the test urn to see if the result is new. Stored as a value in @EDM.PAT.new.results.x.

element.name: results.urn
element.documentation: Used for indexing the test urn to see if the result is new. Stored as a subscript in @EDM.PAT.new.results.x.Used for indexing the test urn to see if the result is new.

element.name: event.hist.function
element.documentation: If this status event was triggered automatically by some routine (i.e., the routine, or Integrated Function, was attached to the status event in the Status Event Dictionary), then this value will exist, and will be equal to the Integrated Function.

element.name: event.hist.start.time
element.documentation: S(0) time.

element.name: event.hist.user
element.documentation: Will be the user's menomonic when the status event is changed unless the call to EDM.PAT.update.status.event is done by a bkg job. In this case it will be EDMBKGJOB.

element.name: nurse
practitioner
practitioner.type
element.documentation: Right now we only have one practitioner type and so we don't bother to record it. This spot is being reserved in case we want to include different types. For example, Med Student, Physician Assistant, Intern etc can all be Practitioners. If we do record these separately then we will want to store the type on the patient (so that it stays static even if the doctor's type changes later..)

element.name: adm.physician
physician
element.documentation: Introduced by C/S EDM DTS 556 (see also @adm.physician) This is the The ER Physician field as recorded in EDM signup routines. This will be the first field EDM looks at when looking for an assigned physician. This may be updated prior to the ADM value being updated if the ADM patient data was locked at the time of staff signup. The ADM value will be synchronized with this once the queued transaction accompanying the signup is processed in the background. In the meantime EDM will not accept physician edits that originated in ADM, as stated in DTS 556. This may not have a value if the patient census data was last filed prior to this DTS. In that case the system should look at @adm.physician. (See element @edm.adm.physician).

element.name: staff.hx.old.value
element.documentation: This could be an MIS.USER or a Provider, depending on what the staff.hx.type is.

element.name: event.start.time
element.documentation: This is the first time that this status event was filed on this patient. If the same status event is filed again (e.g., in the status event history), then this start time remains unchanged.

element.name: status.ind
element.documentation:
ORD = Overdue order Indicator The purpose of this particular indicator is to alert users when a patient has one or more orders which are currently overdue. (i.e. the order is still not back, and the time frame defined in the OE procedure dictionary has been exceeded)
CMT = Comment (General Task) Indicator

element.name: status.ind.text
element.documentation:
This is the text which will appear on the tracker when the keyword sts.ind.ORD is used. The first portion of the text will indicate the number of orders which are currently overdue.
ORD type indicators are only 10 chars long, however the CMT indicator requires 75 chars of free text.

element.name: hx.med.in.progress
element.documentation:
This will be set if we ever launched the Historical Med page. If this is set, we don't bother attempting to link to RXM, nor do we loop thru RXM to build the Med table, as all of this has already been done the first time that we launched the Historical Med page.
This also indicates whether or not we were able to successfully link to RXM:
L = Linked to RXM N = Not linked to RXM

element.name: hxm.cnst.table.id
element.documentation: This is the table app id (NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id) for the medication table which is displayed in the Historical Meds function.

element.name: hxm.cnst.ftr.btn.add
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Add" button located in the footer.

element.name: hxm.cnst.ftr.btn.dc
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Discontinue" button located in the footer.

element.name: hxm.cnst.ftr.btn.undo
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Undo" button located in the footer.

element.name: hxm.cnst.ftr.btn.edit
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Change" button located in the footer.

element.name: hxm.cnst.ftr.btn.view
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "View Details" button located in the footer.

element.name: hx.med.urn
element.documentation:
If this is a new med (thus no urn has been established yet in RXM), this value will be as follows: "NEW"_q
where 'q' is an integer counter.

element.name: hx.med.formulary.med
element.documentation: This is set to "Y" if this drug exists in the RXM Drug Dictionary. Therefore, if the user has entered a free text med which does not exist in the RXM Drug Dictinary, this will be "N" or nil.

element.name: hx.med.action
element.documentation: NEW = New Medication EDIT = Edit to existing medication DC = Discontinue an existing medication CAN = Cancel an existing medication

element.name: int.cnst.ftr.btn.doc
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Document" button which is located in the footer.

element.name: int.cnst.ftr.btn.docs
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Document Spreadsheet" button which is located in the footer.

element.name: int.cnst.ftr.btn.edit
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Edit" button which is located in the footer.

element.name: int.cnst.ftr.btn.undo
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Undo" button which is located in the footer.

element.name: int.cnst.ftr.btn.add
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Add" button which is located in the footer.

element.name: int.cnst.ftr.btn.view
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "View" button which is located in the footer.

element.name: int.cnst.table.width
element.documentation: This is the pixel width of the table which displays in the body of the Interventions function. We subtract 23 pixels from the body width because that is the pixel width of the vertical scrollbar which can appear for a table with many rows.

element.name: int.cnst.table.app.id
element.documentation: This is assigned to @NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id for the main interventions table.

element.name: int.cnst.mi.table.app.id
int.doc.date
element.documentation: This is @ta.date. This should exist for new documentations and edits.

element.name: int.doc.time
element.documentation: This is @ta.date. This should exist for new documentations and edits.

element.name: int.doc.ctr
element.documentation: This is @ta.ctr. This should only exist for edits.

element.name: int.doc.user
element.documentation: This is the user who is documenting. This may not necessarily be the sign on user.

element.name: int.doc.intervention
element.documentation: This is the assessment which is currently being documented, or the assessment which was last documented and the user is filing or cancelling.

element.name: int.doc.action
element.documentation:
These are the different actions which a user can perform on an intervention:
N = New documentation E = Edit documentation V = View documentation

element.name: int.mpg
element.documentation: If we are documenting in a multi-page environment, this is set to "Y". If an Assessment is a "triage" assessment (@EDM.ASSESSMENT.triage="Y"), then we will document that intervention in a multi-page environment, where users can document patient allergies among other things.

element.name: int.mpg.allergies
element.documentation: If we are documenting in a multi-page environment and the user has made allergy changes, this flag is set to "Y". This flag is an indication that we must file allergies when the user finally presses Save.

element.name: int.mpg.patient
element.documentation: Before branching to the mpg driver (while documenting a triage assessment), we need to save the value of /aa, because the MPG driver will nil out the value of /aa due to the fact that "aa" is the value of @NPR.Z.UI.mpg.record.urn. See program %NPR.Z.UI.mpg.driver.M.exit.

element.name: int.doc.int.assmnt
element.documentation: This is the MIS Assessment which is associated to the documentation. This segment is used primarily for documenting, in which case the MIS Assessment is defined in the EDM Assessment dictionary, however, this particular element is also used when viewing or editing a previously filed assessment. In that case, the MIS Assessment is defined as part of the documentation on the patient file.

element.name: int.intervention
element.documentation: Note that the row app id (@NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdata.row.app.id) for Assessments and Treatments is EDM.ASSESSMENT.mnemonic, therefore the row app id will give the necessary access variable for this array.

element.name: int.mis.assmnt
element.documentation: This is the MIS Assessment which is associated with this intervention.

element.name: int.mi.showing
element.documentation: This is the value of @NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdata.row.mi.showing. This is used while building the main table. If we ever need to refresh the table, we want to preserve any "more info" rows which may have been expanded.

element.name: pre.reg.er.quest
element.documentation: This is the questionnaire used when Pre-registering an ER patient in ADM. This is needed by ADM to access certain values while performing an MPI search.

element.name: en.reg.er.quest
element.documentation: This is the ADM questionnaire used when Registering an ER patient.

element.name: ed.reg.er.quest
element.documentation: This is the ADM questionnaire used when performing a Registration Edit on an ER patient.

element.name: en.adm.in.quest
element.documentation: This is the ADM questionnaire used when entering an inpatient admission

element.name: en.adm.in.observ.quest
element.documentation: This is the ADM questionnaire used when entering an inpatient patient (for Observation)

element.name: pci.temp.saf
element.documentation: This exact file name is required for program %Z.view.report.pci. See that program for details.

element.name: data.exists
element.documentation: This is used by the Complete EDM Record (%EDM.PAT.print.patient.record). This is a multiple array which indicates what kind of data has been filed on a patient's record. For example, if any notes have been filed, we would set up /HEDATA["NOTES"], which is subsequenty used in a line check.

element.name: nur.current.assmnt
element.documentation: This is the MIS Assessment mnemonic of the assessment which is currently displayed in the body region.

element.name: nur.table.top
element.documentation: This specifies the value of @NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdef.top. If not specified by calling application, then "M" will be used.

element.name: nur.doc.date
element.documentation: Documentation date.

element.name: nur.doc.time
element.documentation: Documentation time.

element.name: nur.doc.ctr
element.documentation: Documentation counter (this will only exist when "E"diting or "V"iewing an existing documentation). See tech doc for @EDM.PAT.ta.ctr for an explanation of this urn.

element.name: nur.action
element.documentation:
These are the different actions which a user can perform:
N = New Documentation E = Edit Documentation V = View Documentation

element.name: nur.sp.ftr.on
element.documentation: When the calling application sets up the special footer buttons, they are initially inactive. As soon as the user makes a single change to any assessment, we will update the special footer buttons to active. This flag is set to "Y" once the special footer buttons become active.

element.name: nur.ss.changes
element.documentation: This value tracks the number of changes made to the spreadsheet as a whole. As soon as a single valid change is made we should light up the save button. This number will increment if a new value is inserted, or an existing occurrence is DC'd. It can decrement if a user out all new values on the spreadsheet. If the number of changes is greater than 0, the save button will be lit.

element.name: nur.ss.mpg.entry
element.documentation: Indicates we are entering the multi-page sequence with the spreadsheet. When this value = "Y" we will trigger the new column when arriving on the spreadsheet page. The program will set this to nil after the initial entry to prevent asking for a new column if the user navigates back to the spreadsheet from a different page.

element.name: nur.table.app.id
element.documentation: This is the value of @NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id which is used for Assessment documentation tables.

element.name: nur.ss.table.app.id
element.documentation: This is the value of @NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id which is used for the Assessment spreadsheet table.

element.name: nur.ss.qry.table.app.id
element.documentation: This is the value of @NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id which is used for the individual query process screens on the spreadsheet.

element.name: nur.asmnt.new.values
element.documentation: This keeps track of the number of new responses on a particular assessment. When entering a new documentation (i.e., not an "edit"), the value stored here is used to determine whether or not a user can use the "Recall" function. If this number is greater than zero, then recall is not allowed.

element.name: nur.asmnt.occ.change
element.documentation: Once the user either inserts or discontinues an occurrence, this value is set to "Y". This is used in determining whether or not the recall button should be active or not.

element.name: nur.lbl.label
element.documentation: This is MIS.ASSMNT.label.q.

element.name: nur.lbl.emrid
element.documentation: Label EMR ID (from the MIS Assessment Dictionary)

element.name: nur.lbl.total.occs
element.documentation: This is the total number of occurrences for this particular repeatable label. Note that this value will only exist for repeatable labels, as there are no occurrences for non-repeatable labels.

element.name: nur.rpt.key.qry.emrid
element.documentation: This is the query's EMR Data Label as defined in the MIS Assessment Dictionary.

element.name: nur.occ.qry.query
element.documentation: This is the external occurrence number.

element.name: nur.occ.qry.cell
element.documentation: This is the NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tcell.seq number for the response(s) for this query.

element.name: nur.occ.qry.object
element.documentation: This is the NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tcell.obj.seq number for the query response if there is only one response for this query (e.g., Comment). For queries associated with multiple responses (e.g., Several, Group, Y/N), the object sequence number for each response is stored in @nur.qry.rsp.object.

element.name: nur.occ.occurrence
element.documentation: Occurrence number. This number is zero for non-repeatable labels. Note that this number is internal only, and may or may not correspond with the external occurrence number. If users discontinue occurrences, this can cause discrepancies between this internal number, and the true external occurrence number.

element.name: nur.occ.discontinue.flag
element.documentation: This is set to "Y" if this particular occurrence can be discontinued.

element.name: nur.occ.external.occ
element.documentation: This is the external occurrence number which is displayed to the user. This does not necessarily match the internal occurrence subscript (nur.occ.occurrence). This value will be <nil> for any occurrence which has been discontinued.

element.name: nur.occ.cell
element.documentation: This is the cell sequence number (NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tcell.seq) for the occurrence (label) header for this particular occurrence.

element.name: nur.occ.qry.resp.len
element.documentation: Keeps track of response lengths for each occurrence.

element.name: nur.qry.rsp.response
element.documentation: This can be any possible response for this query. For Several, Group, and Optional queries, this value will be the MIS.GROUP.RESP.element.mnemonic. For Yes/No queries, this will be "Y" or "N". Etc.

element.name: nur.qry.rsp.object
element.documentation: This is the NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tcell.obj.seq number for this particular response.

element.name: nur.qry.rsp.selected
element.documentation: This is set to "Y" if this particular response is selected for this query in this occurrence. This is nil if this response is not selected.

element.name: nur.qryx.label
element.documentation: Label # (MIS.ASSMNT.label.q).

element.name: nur.qryx.group.resp
element.documentation: This is the MIS.GROUP.RESP.mnemonic for "G", "S", and "O" type queries.

element.name: nur.qryx.rule.pgm
element.documentation: If this query has a rule associated with it in the MIS Assessment Dictionary, this value will be the name of the rule program which must be executed.

element.name: nur.qryx.hide
element.documentation: This is the value of @MIS.ASSMNT.query.hide. In certain programs, the value of MIS.ASSMNT.query.q is not available, therefore we store this value here for quick reference.

element.name: nur.cnst.checkbox.width
element.documentation: This is the width (in pixels) of the NPR Picture, "UI BOX CHECKED", and all of its derivatives.

element.name: nur.cnst.radio.btn.width
element.documentation: This is the width (in pixels) of the NPR Picture, "UI BTN RADIO SEL", and all of its derivatives.

element.name: nur.cnst.query.width
element.documentation: This is the length (in pixels) of the query text column (i.e., column #1) on the doc assessment table.

element.name: nur.cnst.label.height
element.documentation: This is the height (in pixels) of the table row which contains the Assessment label text.

element.name: nur.cnst.query.height
element.documentation: This is the height (in pixels) of a row of data for a query and its responses. If there are multiple physical rows in a single logical row (e.g., a Group type query with many responses), then each physical row will be 16 pixels in height.

element.name: nur.cnst.table.width
element.documentation: This is the pixel width of the table which displays in the body while documenting an assessment. We subtract 23 pixels from the body width because that is the pixel width of the vertical scrollbar which can appear for a table with many rows.

element.name: nur.cnst.resp.min.width
element.documentation: This is the minimum width of a column of group responses in the Assessment Documentation table. This minimum width will help to align the columns of different queries.

element.name: nur.cnst.row.buffer
element.documentation: This is the pixel height of the buffer which is placed above AND below each logical row in the Assessment Documentation table. This helps space out the queries vertically.

element.name: nur.cnst.radio.sel
element.documentation: This is the mnemonic from the NPR.PICTURE dictionary for a selected radio button.

element.name: nur.cnst.radio.unsel
element.documentation: This is the mnemonic from the NPR.PICTURE dictionary for an unselected radio button.

element.name: nur.cnst.chkbx.sel
element.documentation: This is the mnemonic from the NPR.PICTURE dictionary for a selected checkbox.

element.name: nur.cnst.chkbx.unsel
element.documentation: This is the mnemonic from the NPR.PICTURE dictionary for an unselected checkbox.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.recall
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Recall Values" button located in the footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.ins.occ
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Insert Occurrence" button located in the footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.dis.occ
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Discontinue Occurrence" button located in the footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.goto
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Go to" button located in the footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.new.col
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Insert Column" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.del.col
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Delete Column" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.copy
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Copy" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.paste
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Paste" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.clear
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Clear" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.ed.dt.tm
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Edit Date Time" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.view.hx
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "View Hx" button located in the spreadsheet footer.

element.name: nur.cnst.other.grp.resp
element.documentation: This value uniquely identifies an "other" response for Optional type queries. Note that this value is 11 characters in length - this is very important. The length of MIS.GROUP.RESP.element.mnemonic is 10 characters, therefore by setting this value to a string which is greater than 10 characters in length, it is impossible for this value to exactly match a value from the Group Response dictionary, thus making this value entirely unique.

element.name: nur.cnst.ftr.btn.ed.user
element.documentation: This is the button application identifier for the "Edit User" button located in the documentation footer.

element.name: pdl.type
element.documentation: AD= Additional Instructions LA= Pt Language CA= Reminders PT= Patient Instructions CO= Condition RE= Referrals CM= Comment RX= Rx/Monographs CU= CDS TA= Take Home Meds DE= Departure Info DI= Disposition DX= Diagnosis FO= Forms

element.name: pdl.row
element.documentation: Table Row for this function

element.name: pdl.image2
element.documentation: This field is set if the cells for this seq may have a clickable image object.

element.name: pdl.entry.rpt.text
element.documentation:
this element's purpose is to hold a different value to be printed on a depart rpt than displays on the depart process screen.
it is currently only used for Prescriptions and Monographs

element.name: pdl.entry.pt.inst.source
element.documentation: Indicates whether pt instructions are from PIC or from MIS. This is setup based on the value in MRI.PAT.pic.instr.source. This is used to determine which rpt to call when printing instructs via departure.

element.name: pdl.entry.flag
element.documentation:
For meds, this flag indicates whether the med is a Script (flag="R") or a Monograph (flag="M")
For assessments, this flag indicates is the assessment has been undone (flag="U")

element.name: pdl.entry.mono.print
element.documentation: For scripts and monographs, if Print Monograph (RXM.RX.pd.print.mono) exists, set this to "Y". If Monograph is not checked to be printed, this value will be nil.

element.name: pdl.entry.checked
element.documentation: This flag is set to Y if the Pt Instruct has been checked. N if it is just Suggested.

element.name: pdl.entry.length
element.documentation: Length of entry text + check box in pixels.

element.name: pdl.entry.q
element.documentation: Saved value of pdl.entry.seq to be used when this segment is stored in a temp file

element.name: pdl.entry.cell
element.documentation: Table cell associated with entry

element.name: pdl.entry.obj
element.documentation: Table Object associated with Entry

element.name: pdl.entry.cds
element.documentation: CDS associated with entry.

element.name: pdl.entry.icon
element.documentation: The icon to be displayed for CDS response or Notes.

element.name: pdl.entry.image
element.documentation: Clickable Icon Associated with Entry

element.name: pdl.entry.image.pgm
element.documentation: Program to execute when clicking on image.

element.name: pdl.entry.image.macro
element.documentation: Macro to execute when clicking on image.

element.name: pdl.entry.image.arg
element.documentation: Argument to use with Image Pgm/Macro

element.name: pdl.entry.refer.type
element.documentation: Type of Referral being displayed

element.name: pdl.entry.specialty
element.documentation: Flags Referral Providers from the Specialty list. This is needed to separate them from Providers added from the complete list.

element.name: pdl.entry.notes
element.documentation: Additional notes for the Depart screen

element.name: pdl.entry.cl.imp
element.documentation: Designates this entry as being defaulted due to a Clinical Response. This allows us to easily remove Clin Response defaults if the user unchecks it without filing.

element.name: pdl.entry.free.text
element.documentation: Designates this as a free text clinical impression.

element.name: pdl.entry.followup
element.documentation: Followup Plan

element.name: pdl.entry.followup.img
element.documentation: Icon mnemonic which the user can click to enter a Followup Plan response.

element.name: pdl.entry.followup.txt
element.documentation: Text of Followup Plan response to be displayed on the Depart Screen

element.name: pdl.entry.followup.pgm
element.documentation: Program to execute when clicking on the Followup Plan icon

element.name: pdl.entry.followup.macro
element.documentation: Macro to execute when clicking on the Followup Plan icon

element.name: pdl.entry.followup.arg
element.documentation: Arguments to send the program executed when clicking on the Followup Plan icon

element.name: pdl.icon.jfy
element.documentation: Should only be used if there is text associated with the icon. Determines whether the icon is to the Right or Left of the text.

element.name: pdl.icon.width
element.documentation: Width of icon in pixels.

element.name: pdl.icon.cell
element.documentation: Icon's table cell.

element.name: pdl.icon.obj
element.documentation: Icon's obj seq

element.name: pdl.icon.space
element.documentation: Table format routine should reserve space for this icon even if not active.

element.name: pdl.icon.left
element.documentation: Icon object location

element.name: pl.type
element.documentation: (A)ssessments (T)reatments (N)otes (D)iagnoses (P)riority (S)tatus Event (AL) Allergies/Adverse Reactions (M) Active Prescriptions and Historical Meds

element.name: pl.ctrl
element.documentation: Indicates the current state of this line (Expanded/Collapsed)

element.name: pl.options
element.documentation: String of available buttons, identified by their shortcut keys. This does not include buttons which are always available.

element.name: pl.entries.cnt
element.documentation: Indicates how many entry lines are a child of this header.

element.name: pl.detail.text
element.documentation: Text which should appear in the multiple.

element.name: pl.detail.options
element.documentation: String of available buttons, identified by their shortcut keys. This does not include buttons which are always available.

element.name: pl.detail.flag
element.documentation:
Indicates whether the entry should be flagged as Edited, Amended or Undone.
Edited and Undone have a leading space so that they are all aligned properly on the process screen.

element.name: pl.detail.subscripts
pl.detail.query
element.documentation: The Query for this detail line

element.name: pl.entry.text
element.documentation: Text which should appear in the multiple.

element.name: pl.entry.ctrl
element.documentation: Indicates the current state of this line (Expanded/Collapsed)

element.name: pl.entry.options
element.documentation: String of available buttons, identified by their shortcut keys. This does not include buttons which are always available.

element.name: pl.entry.flag
element.documentation:
This is used to flag various entries on the process screen. This value is always displayed right-justified in a 13 character field. This flag is used variably in different sections as follows:
Assessments - Undone, Edited Treatments - Undone Active Prescriptions/Hx Meds - Hx Med, <Start date or Rx>, Profile

element.name: pl.detail.cnt
element.documentation: Indicates how many detail lines are a child of this entry.

element.name: pl.entry.subscripts
element.documentation:
This is a packed piece containing the subscripts of the originating datastructure. For example, for assessments this would look like this: {ta.intervention}.
For coded allergies, this is {"C",MRI.ALLERGY.allergy}, and for uncoded allergies, this is {"U",MRI.ALLERGY.uallergy}.
For Active Prescriptions/Hx Meds, this is {RXM.RX.urn}.

element.name: pl.entry.required
element.documentation: Used to indicate if a list entry is required to be documented. (Currently used only for treatments and assessments.) If "Y" the list entry is displayed in green.

element.name: pl.entry.source
element.documentation: Used to display the Source of an intervention

element.name: pl.entry.history
element.documentation: Intervention hisory info

element.name: pl.entry.last.user
element.documentation: Last User for intervention

element.name: pm.current
element.documentation: this field was used in the EP. It is not needed here because of the use of Z.sel.scrn

element.name: pm.top
element.documentation: Indicates which @ps.seq is the first entry showing in the multiple.

element.name: pm.itn
element.documentation: Indicates the @.itn of the current item.

element.name: pm.always.on.buttons
element.documentation: This is a list of buttons which are Always On regardless of what the current item is. Examples C Expand/Collapse M RXM N Get NUR Data

element.name: pm.mult.size.param
element.documentation: Indicates how many lines of the multiple are drawn on the screen.

element.name: pm.header.quantity
element.documentation: Indicates how many lists or headers are displayed.This is useful in determining if all of the entries are collapsed or not.

element.name: pp.meds.rpt.text
element.documentation:
this element's purpose is to hold a different value to be printed on a depart rpt than displays on the depart process screen.
it is currently only used for Prescriptions and Monographs

element.name: pp.meds.pt.inst.source
element.documentation: Indicates whether pt instructions are from PIC or from MIS. This is setup based on the value in MRI.PAT.pic.instr.source. This is used to determine which rpt to call when printing instructs via departure.

element.name: pp.meds.flag
element.documentation:
For meds, this flag indicates whether the med is a Script (flag="R") or a Monograph (flag="M")
For assessments, this flag indicates is the assessment has been undone (flag="U")

element.name: pp.meds.mono.print
element.documentation: For scripts and monographs, if Print Monograph (RXM.RX.pd.print.mono) exists, set this to "Y". If Monograph is not checked to be printed, this value will be nil.

element.name: pp.meds.checked
element.documentation: This flag is set to Y if the Pt Instruct has been checked. N if it is just Suggested.

element.name: ps.text
element.documentation: The text which appears on the screen. This also includes any @Set.attr commands which are used for different colors.

element.name: ps.mark
element.documentation:
The mark which appears on the left side of the multiple indicating whether an entry can be expanded or collapsed.
This also includes any @Set.attr commands which are used for different colors.

element.name: ps.list.id
element.documentation: Points to @pl.seq, indicating where this line was built from.

element.name: ps.entry.id
element.documentation: Points to @pl.entry.seq, indicating where this line was built from.

element.name: ps.detail.id
element.documentation: Points to @pl.detail.seq, indicating where this line was built from.

element.name: ps.heading.color
element.documentation: Exists only if the mark/text are drawn in a different color. This is the numeric value of the attribute used to draw them.

element.name: recept.name
element.documentation:
The following field check for this data def was taken from @ADM.PAT.name:
@.new#0'?1A!(@.new#"1,"#0_"A"'?2A)!(@.new#L(@.new$3%0)?1N)

element.name: recept.birthdate
element.attributes: FCL01=@.new>@.update.today FCL01A=@W.err("Cannot be in the future.")

element.name: recept.arrival.date
element.attributes: FCL1=@.new>@.update.today FCL1A=@W.err("Can't be in the future.") FCL2=@.new<(@.today-10000) FCL2A=@W.err("Too far in the past.") REQI=Y

element.name: recept.arrival.time
element.attributes: FCL1=@recept.arrival.date=@.update.today&(@.new>@.now) FCL1A=@W.err("Can't be in the future.") REQI=Y

element.name: recept.xfer.patient
element.documentation: Set to "Y" if this patient is a transfer from ADM, i.e. a /A lookup was performed in the reception routine.

element.name: rm.occupancy
element.documentation: Indicates how many patients are currently occupying the room. This is the total of patients in permanent beds and of patients in temporary beds.

element.name: rm.available
element.documentation: Indicates how many available beds there are in the room. This is the number of permanent beds minus dirty, blocked, in use, and reserved.

element.name: swipe.hcn
element.documentation: Health care number.

element.name: swipe.moh.response
element.documentation: Response code from the Ministry of Health.

element.name: call.process.table.id
element.documentation: This is the value which is passed to @UI.table.create for the calls table (i.e., @NPR.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id).

element.name: call.process.new.call
element.documentation: This is used to indicate whether or not the user is entering a new call, or whether they are editing an existing call (set to "Y" if entering a new call).

element.name: call.process.hilite.row
element.documentation: This is used when displaying the calls table. If this value is set, then we will highlight this call after displaying the table. This value should be set to the value of EDM.PAT.call.q which corresponds to the call which we wish to highlight.

element.name: sect.chked.qty
element.documentation: the # of departure sections checked on the print departure sections screen

element.name: instructs.chked
element.documentation: set to "Y" when printing departure sections (not packet) and Instructs data is selected to print

element.name: rx.chked
element.documentation: set to "Y" when printing departure sections (not packet) and RX data is selected to print

element.name: tep.birthdate
element.attributes: FCL1=@.new>@.today FCL1A=@W.err("Cannot be in the future.") FCL2=%Z.age(@.new)^@tep.age,@Display(@tep.age)

element.name: tep.arrival.date
element.attributes: FCL1=@.new>@.update.today FCL1A=@W.err("Can not be in the future.") FCL2=@.new<(@.today-10000) FCL2A=@W.err("Too far in the past.") FCL3=@.new>@tep.triage.date&@tep.triage.date FCL3A=@W.err("Can not be after the triage date.")

element.name: tep.arrival.time
element.attributes: FCL1=@tep.arrival.date=@.update.today&(@.new>@.now) FCL1A=@W.err("Can not be in the future.") FCL2=@tep.arrival.date=@tep.triage.date&(@.new>@tep.triage.time)&@tep.triage.time FCL2A=@W.err("Can not be after triage time.")

element.name: tep.triage.date
element.attributes: FCL1=@.new>@.today FCL1A=@W.err("Can not be in the future.") FCL2=@.new<(@.today-10000) FCL2A=@W.err("Too far in the past.") FCL3=@.new<@tep.arrival.date FCL3A=@W.err("Can not be prior to arrival date.")

element.name: tep.triage.time
element.attributes: FCL1=@tep.triage.date=@.today&(@.new>@.now) FCL1A=@W.err("Can not be in the future.") FCL2=@tep.arrival.date=@tep.triage.date&(@.new<@tep.arrival.time) FCL2A=@W.err("Can not be prior to arrival time.")

element.name: note.process.table.id
element.documentation: This is the value which is passed to @UI.table.create for the notes table (i.e., @NPR.UI.tmp.tdef.app.id).

element.name: note.process.left.margin
element.documentation: This is the number of pixels to indent each cell (@NPR.Z.UI.tmp.tcell.left) in the table which displays a patient's notes and addenda.

element.name: note.process.right.margin
element.documentation: This is the number of pixels which should be added to each column of data in the table which displays a patient's notes. This allows a buffer between the last character in the column, and the vertical line which separates each column.

element.name: note.process.exp.clp.wdth
element.documentation: This is the width in pixels of the space which is allocated for the expand/collapse icon which appears in the table that is used for notes.

element.name: note.process.current.scrn
element.documentation: This is the current screen which is displayed beneath the note table (i.e., the value passed to @UI.screen.create). If you need to display a different table than what is currently stored here, then you should perform a @UI.screen.remove for this screen before displaying the new screen.

element.name: note.process.hilite.row
element.documentation: This is used when displaying the notes table. If this value is set, then we will highlight this note after displaying the table. This value should be set to the value of EDM.PAT.note.q which corresponds to the note which we wish to highlight.

element.name: tmp.prt.cursor.stack
element.documentation: Contains the number of times that the current cursor position was "pushed" onto the printer stack. Incremented by one each time the current cursor position is pushed, and decremented by one each time the current cursor position is popped from the stack. The "PUSH" and "POP" commands are executed via PCL escape sequences.

element.name: tmp.prt.landscape.column
element.documentation:
This contains the current column when printing in Landscape orientation. When printing in Landscape orientation, there are two columns (1 and 2). This variable will indicate which column we are currently printing. Thus, when we get to the bottom of the page of column 1, we simply begin printing at the top of column 2; when we get to the bottom of the page of column 2, we eject the current page, and begin printing a new page.
***NOTE - The existence of this slash variable indicates Landscape orientation in several programs, therefore this should always be nil when printing in Portrait orientation.

element.name: tmp.prt.trailer.lines
element.documentation: This is set to the value of (@EDM.RPT.trailer.lines+1). This is used by the EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.line.print macro to determine when it is time to go to a new page.

element.name: tmp.prt.lines.left
element.documentation: This is the value of @.lines.left after the header region has printed and before the detail region begins to print. We save this so that the value of @.lines.left can be restored when we move from the bottom of column 1 to the top of column 2 (Landscape printing).

element.name: tmp.prt.cpl
element.documentation: This contains the number of characters per line for the report. Note that we can not refer to @Z.rpt.cpl for this value, because if we are printing the Landscape version of the report, @Z.rpt.cpl is set to the entire width, which is 189, and we only want our CPL to be set to 92 for both portrait and landscape printing.

element.name: tmp.prt.rpt.width
element.documentation: This is the value which is assigned to @tmp.prt.cpl, and which is also referenced in some of the dictionary (EDM.RPT) routines. This is the number of characters per line for portrait printing, or the number of characters per column for landscape printing.

element.name: tmp.prt.cl.text
element.documentation: This is the line which should printed as part of the continued header on the patient report. This can contain escape sequences as well as printable text.

element.name: tmp.prt.cl.cr.lf
element.documentation: This is the value which is assinged to local 'CR.LF' in macro M.line.print. This indicates whether or not a CRLF should be issued after the text is printed.

element.name: tmp.prt.cl.move.cursor
element.documentation: This is the value which is assinged to local 'MOVE.CURSOR' in macro M.line.print. This indicates whether or not the cursor should be moved to the start of the second column in landscape printing.

element.name: esc.font
element.documentation:
There are 4 basic font commands which we can turn on or off. They are:
B = Bold I = Italics U = Underline R = Reverse (white on black)
The lowercase letter turns the respective command "off". For example, "b" means turn bolding off. Various combinations are available (e.g., BI, BIU, etc). Note that these font commands are very specific in relation to the font commands which exist in @Z.rpt.fonts. These are typically used in special circumstances when we have a wide variety of fonts on a single line.

element.name: esc.font.cmd
element.documentation: This is the Hewlett Packard PCL5 escape sequence necessary to invoke various print characteristics (e.g., bolding).

element.name: tmp.gr.box.type
element.documentation:
This is argument 'A' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.
0 = Black border 1 = Grey box 2 = Grey box and black border

element.name: tmp.gr.length
element.documentation: This is argument 'B' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.

element.name: tmp.gr.height
element.documentation: This is argument 'C' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.

element.name: tmp.gr.move.x
element.documentation: This is argument 'D' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.

element.name: tmp.gr.move.y
element.documentation: This is argument 'E' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.

element.name: tmp.gr.gray.scale
element.documentation: This is argument 'F' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.

element.name: tmp.gr.line.width
element.documentation: This is argument 'G' for EDM.PAT.print.patient.rpt.M.graphics.

element.name: tmp.rf.data
element.documentation: This is the data which is output by the report fragment. It can consist of control codes (such as PCL5 escape sequences) and printable characters.

element.name: rpt.process.name
element.documentation: General description of the report or addendum.

element.name: rpt.process.date.time
element.documentation: External date/time.

element.name: rpt.process.doc.q
element.documentation: This is the same as EDM.PAT.doc.q

element.name: rpt.process.type
element.documentation: R = Report A = Addendum

element.name: rpt.process.last.edit.q
element.documentation: When this file is built, this is the last edit "q" for this particular document (i.e., @Last(doc.edit.q)). When a user wishes to edit a document in the process routine, we check this value with the value on disk, and if they are different, the user is not allowed to perform the edit, and that user's process screen is updated with any new values (e.g., status change). A different value indicates that some other user has edited this document since this process file was built.

element.name: rpt.process.selected
element.documentation: This is used in the Cancel Doc routine. It is set to @EDM.U.fat.check.mark.2 for documents that have been selected for cancellation.

element.name: rpt.process.report.name
element.documentation: Name to display on the process screen for a report containing text.

element.name: rpt.process.num.rows
element.documentation: This is the number of rows in the multiple on screen in %EDM.PAT.report.

element.name: rpt.process.cancel.row
element.documentation: This is the starting row for the multiple in program %EDM.PAT.cancel.doc.

element.name: rpt.process.can.num.rows
element.documentation: This is the number of rows in the multiple on screen %EDM.PAT.cancel.doc.

element.name: rpt.process.arrow.col
element.documentation: Column where the up/down arrows should display on the 'Provider Report' process screen.

element.name: tmp.ta.assmnt
element.documentation:
MIS Assessment
This will be the sub-assessment for group type assessments.

element.name: tmp.ta.occ.change
element.documentation: This is set to "Y" if the user either discontinues or inserts an occurrence under any label on the assessment. Once this value is set to "Y", the "Recall" option will no longer appear in the drop down menu.

element.name: tmp.ta.new.values
element.documentation: This keeps track of the number of new responses on a particular assessment. When entering a new documentation (i.e., not an "edit"), the value stored here is used to determine whether or not a user can use the "Recall" function. If this number is greater than zero, then recall is not allowed.

element.name: tmp.ta.adv.nxt.qry.row
element.documentation: When advancing to a new query, this is the value of 'tmp.ta.qry.row' for that query. If the query is in a repeatable label, this will be for the first occurrence regardless of the number of occurrences which may exist.

element.name: tmp.ta.adv.keystroke
element.documentation: In the CONTROL loop, we do not want to perform a read (%Z.scrn.read) if we need to skip to a new query. This value is assigned to local variable 'KEY' so that the CONTROL loop knows what to do (e.g, scroll the screen, or pop up an input box such as the numeric keypad, etc.).

element.name: tmp.ta.adv.mouse
element.documentation: This value is assigned to @Z.mouse.

element.name: tmp.ta.eec.src.qry
element.documentation: The local of this data def must be the same as @tmp.ta.rcl.src.qry (program %EDM.PAT.triage.doc.assmnt.guts relies on this equality).

element.name: tmp.ta.eec.target.qry
element.documentation: The local of this data def must be the same as @tmp.ta.rcl.target.qry (program %EDM.PAT.triage.doc.assmnt.guts relies on this equality).

element.name: tmp.ta.lab.row
element.documentation: Starting Row for this label.

element.name: tmp.ta.lab.q
element.documentation: Label #

element.name: tmp.ta.lab.o
element.documentation: Occurrence # of this label. Note that this is the internal occurrence number (i.e., @tmp.ta.rpt.occ), NOT the external occurrence number.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry
element.documentation: Query menmonic.

element.name: tmp.ta.label.q
element.documentation: Label # for this query.

element.name: tmp.ta.group.response
element.documentation: Group Response for this query.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.type
element.documentation: This is the same as @MIS.QUERY.type.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.desc
element.documentation: Query description - IF{@MIS.ASSMNT.query.prompt;@MIS.QUERY.text}

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.rule
element.documentation: If this query has a rule filed on it in the MIS Assmnt Dictionary, then this value will be the name of the rule program which needs to be executed.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.q
element.documentation: This is the query "q" number from the MIS Assmnt Dictionary (i.e., MIS.ASSMNT.query.q).

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.row
element.documentation: Starting Row for this query.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.lq
element.documentation: Label # for this query.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.lo
element.documentation: Label occurrence # for this query.

element.name: tmp.ta.qry.mnem
element.documentation: Query's menmonic.

element.name: tmp.ta.rbtn.rc
element.documentation: Occurrence #

element.name: tmp.ta.rbtn.qry
element.documentation: Query menmonic

element.name: tmp.ta.rbtn.row
element.documentation: Indicates (along with @tmp.ta.rbtn.col) where the current response (if there is one) for this query is on the screen.

element.name: tmp.ta.rbtn.col
element.documentation: Indicates (along with @tmp.ta.rbtn.row) where the current response (if there is one) for this query is on the screen.

element.name: tmp.ta.rcl.src.qry
element.documentation: The local of this data def must be the same as @tmp.ta.eec.src.qry (program %EDM.PAT.triage.doc.assmnt.guts relies on this equality).

element.name: tmp.ta.rcl.target.qry
element.documentation: The local of this data def must be the same as @tmp.ta.eec.target.qry (program %EDM.PAT.triage.doc.assmnt.guts relies on this equality).

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.lq
element.documentation: Label #

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.emrid
element.documentation: EMR Label ID

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.total.occs
element.documentation:
This is the total number of occurrences for this label. The total number of occurrences could be found very easily with some simple computations, however this value is stored for quick reference (especially in the Calculation and Rule programs).
For example, here are some ways to compute this value:
1) DO{@Next(tmp.ta.rpt.occ) @Add(1,NUM.OCCURRENCES)}
2) @Last(tmp.ta.rpt.occ),@tmp.ta.rpt.occ.ext.num^NUM.OCCURRENCES

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.key
element.documentation: MIS Query mnemonic

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.key.emrlab
element.documentation: Query EMR label as defined in MIS.ASSMNT dictionary

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.key.gr
element.documentation: Group Response mnemonic of the key query, as defined in either the MIS.ASSMNT. dictionary or the MIS.QUERY dictionary.

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.occ
element.documentation:
Internal occurrence #.
Note that this can be different than the "external" occurrence #. For example, if an earlier occurrence is discontinued, this subscript is not decremented after the earlier occurrence is deleted. This will result in "holes" in the sequencing of this subscript, but that is harmless.

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.occ.type
element.documentation: "K" if predefined key version "D" if dictionary version

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.occ.ext.num
element.documentation:
External Occurrence #.
Note that this can be different than the "internal" occurrence number. The sequencing of this number never contains "holes". The internal occurrence number (which is the subscript for this data segment) can contain "holes" whenever an occurrence is discontinued.

element.name: tmp.ta.rpt.occ.new
element.documentation: Set up if the occurence has been newly inserted during the documentation.

element.name: mis.assmnt.obj.type
element.documentation:
The possible values for this are:
1) Query Type (e.g., Q, N, C, S, etc.) 2) "YC" = Yes/No comment checkbox 3) "QRY" = Query text 4) "QRYS" = "Select all that apply" text 5) "QRYD" = Query descriptor text 6) "LAB" = Label text

element.name: mis.assmnt.obj.units
element.documentation: The unit for Result type queries is appended to the result during display. The unit is derived from the MIS Query dictionary (@MIS.QUERY.hh.units).

element.name: tta.resp.start.col
element.documentation: This is the starting column for all responses on the Documentation screen. Regardless of query type, all response fields begin in column 25 (e.g., cutout boxes, checkboxes, etc.).

element.name: intsort.occurrence
element.documentation: This indicates the internal occurrence based on the /INTSORT file sent from ADM. This may or may not be equal to @nur.occ.occurrence, as not all occurrences in /INTSORT will be on a particular documentation.

element.name: ss.ta.new.values
element.documentation: Tracks the number of queries the user has documented on a particular documentation. Used to determine whether the documentation should be filed. If this number is 0 ,and ss.ta.chgd.occs is 0, the documentation will be skipped upon filing since no data was entered.

element.name: ss.ta.chgd.occs
element.documentation: Tracks the number of occurrences the user has either inserted or discontinued for a particular documentation. Used to determine whether the documentation should be filed. If this number is 0, and ss.ta.new.values is 0, the documentation will be skipped upon filing since no data was entered.

element.name: ss.ta.action
element.documentation: Tracks whether an occurrence was newly inserted or discontinued. DC = Newly Discontinued INS = Newly inserted OLD = Previously Discontinued

element.name: ss.ta.qry.resp.len
element.documentation: Keeps track of response lengths for each occurrence. The total length of all responses on all keys for the occurrence cannot exceed approximately 230 characters or we will crash when filing to EMR.

element.name: tmp.ta.rep.ctr
element.documentation: Label.q_._Occurence.q

element.name: wl.process.time
element.documentation: Non-nil if patient has been waiting too long, thus display in red color. Thenon-nil value is equal to the amount of time for which the patient is overdue inthe following format: Xh YYm (e.g., 1h 22m).

element.name: wl.process.overdue
element.documentation: "Y" if the patient has been waiting longer at a status event than their priority allows.

element.name: xfer.q
element.documentation: Integer counter.

element.name: xfer.seconds
element.documentation: S(0) time that this entry was filed on the queue.

element.name: xfer.user
element.documentation: This is needed so that @ADM.PAT.last.edit.user can be set up properly.

element.name: xfer.type
element.documentation: CEN = Simple edit of data such as ER doctor, Location, Triage Date/Time, etc. TRG = Triage/Date Time from Triage/Doc Routine Additional types can be added for use in EDM.PAT.xfer.queue and EDM.PAT.xfer.queue.process
